photoshop.empty

Class Picture

  • java.lang.Object
    • photoshop.empty.Picture

  • public class Picture
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that represents a picture made up of a rectangle of Pixels

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Picture(java.awt.Color color, int height, int width)
      Creates a solid-color Picture of a given color, width, and height
      Picture(int height, int width)
      Creates a solid white Picture of a given width and height
      Picture(int red, int green, int blue, int height, int width)
      Creates a solid-color Picture of a given color, width, and height
      Picture(Picture picture)
      Creates a Picture based off of an existing Picture
      Picture(Pixel[][] pixels)
      Creates a Picture based off of an existing Pixel 2D array
      Picture(java.lang.String picture)
      Creates a Picture from an image file in the "images" directory

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Picture blur(int dist)
      perform a blur using the colors of pixels within dist of current pixel
      void chromakey(Picture other, java.awt.Color color, int dist)
      copy another picture's pixels into this picture, if a color is within dist of param Color
      Picture decode()
      steganography decode (return a new Picture containing the message hidden in this picture)

      detect and mark edges in an image

      steganography encode (hide the message in msg in this picture)
      void fixRoof()
      fix roof on greek temple

      Gets the height of the Picture
      Pixel getPixel(int x, int y)
      Gets the Pixel at a given coordinate
      Pixel[][] getPixels()
      Return the 2D array of pixels that comprise this Picture You can save a reference to a Picture's pixels with the following: Pixel[][] pixels = pic.getPixels(); //for a Picture object called pic

      Gets the width of the Picture
      Picture glassFilter(int dist)
      Simulate looking at an image through a pane of glass

      convert an image to grayscale

      mirror about a horizontal midline, top to bottom

      invert a picture's colors

      reduces the number of colors in an image to create a "graphic poster" effect
      void save()
      Save the image on disk as a JPEG Call programmatically on a Picture object, it will prompt you to choose a save location In the save dialogue window, specify the file AND extension (e.g.

      Sets the Pixel at a given coordinate
      Picture simpleBlur()
      perform a simple blur using the colors of neighboring pixels

      simulate the over-exposure of a picture in film processing

      tint (change) a pictures RGB components by supplied factors

      flip an image upside down about its bottom edge

      Opens a PictureViewer to view this Picture

        blue - The blue value of the color
        height - The height of the Picture
        width - The width of the Picture

        public Picture(Pixel[][] pixels)
        Creates a Picture based off of an existing Pixel 2D array
        Parameters:
        pixels - A rectangular 2D array of Pixels. Must be at least 1x1

      • view

        public PictureViewer view()
        Opens a PictureViewer to view this Picture
        Returns:
        the PictureViewer viewing the Picture

      • getPixels

        public Pixel[][] getPixels()
        Return the 2D array of pixels that comprise this Picture You can save a reference to a Picture's pixels with the following: Pixel[][] pixels = pic.getPixels(); //for a Picture object called pic
        Returns:
        2D array of pixels that make up this Picture

      • save

        public void save()
        Save the image on disk as a JPEG Call programmatically on a Picture object, it will prompt you to choose a save location In the save dialogue window, specify the file AND extension (e.g. "lilies.jpg") Extension must be .jpg as ImageIO is expecting to write a jpeg

      • glassFilter

        public Picture glassFilter(int dist)
        Simulate looking at an image through a pane of glass
        Parameters:
        dist - the "radius" of the neighboring pixels to use
        Returns:
        a new Picture with the glass filter applied
